sen.e: His father died when he was three years old and he was brought up by this grandfather, Kinsumi SHIGENOI, who was famous as a specialist for Yusoku-kojitsu (knowledge of court rules, ceremony, decorum and records of the past).

sen.j: 元文4年（1739年）に元服して従五位下侍従に任じられ、宝暦8年（1758年）に従三位参議となり、宝暦11年（1761年）に検非違使別当兼右兵衛督、宝暦13年（1763年）に正三位権中納言となる。
sen.e: In 1739, he celebrated his attainment of manhood and appointed as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) jiju (a chamberlain), and, in 1758, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Sangi (councillor), and, in 1761, Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police) and, concurrently, Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), and, in 1763, he became Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).

sen.j: 明和5年（1768年）には正二位権大納言（兼大宰権帥）に昇ったが権大納言は同年中、兼務の権帥も安永5年（1776年）に退いた。
sen.e: In 1768, he was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) (concurrently, Dazai gon no sochi (Provisional Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices)), but he resigned from Gon Dainagon within same year and concurrent position, Dazai gon no sochi in 1776.

sen.j: 祖父の学術を引き継いで当代屈指の有職故実の大家とされ、和歌や絵画にも優れていた。
sen.e: Succeeding his grandfather's academic knowledge, he was accepted as a great living specialist for Yusoku-kojitsu (knowledge of court rules, ceremony, decorum and records of the past) and he was also good at waka and painting.

sen.e: When he was twenty-two years old, he published "狩衣至要鈔" and, then, published many books including "禁秘御抄階梯", "公事根源鈔階梯", "諒闇装束之事", "一上要覧", "摂関要覧", "彗星出現年々" and "滋草拾露" (personal complete works).

sen.j: 同時代の公卿で歴史家としても知られていた柳原紀光は、訃報を聞いて日記に「彼卿無漢才、於抄物日記等事者、博覧之人也」と評している。
sen.e: Hearing about Kinkazu's death, Norimitsu YANAGIHARA, who was a noble and historian of the same period, commented in his diary "彼卿無漢才、於抄物日記等事者、博覧之人也."
